For example: "http://www.aspose.com" or "mailto:admin@aspose.com". The CellCommand Type means that the hyperlink will fire a CellCommand event, and you may handle this event.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.WebCells.Sort(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sorts the datas ascend top to bottom in a range of a WebWorksheet by specified column index.
member.param: The row number of the first cell to sort.
The column number of the first cell to sort.
Number of rows to be imported.
Number of columns to be imported.
The column index that specifis the sort column.

example.code:
[C#]
GridWeb1.WebWorksheets[0].Cells.Sort(1,0,25,6,3);
[VB]
GridWeb1.WebWorksheets(0).Cells.Sort(1,0,25,6,3)

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.WebCells.Sort(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.SortOrder,Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.SortOrientation,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sorts the datas ascend top to bottom in a range of a WebWorksheet by specified column index.
member.param: The row number of the first cell to sort.
The column number of the first cell to sort.
Number of rows to be imported.
Number of columns to be imported.

The column(or row) index that specifis the sort column(or row). If sort orientation is top to bottom, the index represents column index. If sort orientation is left to right, the index represents row index.
The sort orientation: top to bottom or left to right.
Indicates whether the sort data is case sensitive if the data is string.

example.code:
[C#]
GridWeb1.WebWorksheets[0].Cells.Sort(0,1,4,14,3,SortOrder.Ascending,SortOrientation.SortLeftToRight,true)
[VB]
GridWeb1.WebWorksheets(0).Cells.Sort(0,1,4,14,3,SortOrder.Ascending,SortOrientation.SortLeftToRight,True)

member.param: The row number of the first cell to sort.
The column number of the first cell to sort.
Number of rows to be imported.
Number of columns to be imported.
The column indexes array that specifies the data sorted by.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.WebCells.Sort(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.SortOrder[],Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.SortOrientation,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sorts the datas ascend in a range of a WebWorksheet by some field that are specifed by indexes array.
member.remarks: If you use this method to sort a block of data, please be sure that length of the parameter indexes equals length of the parameter orders.
member.param: The row number of the first cell to sort.
The column number of the first cell to sort.
Number of rows to be imported.
Number of columns to be imported.

The column(or row) index that specifis the sort column(or row). If sort orientation is top to bottom, the index represents column index. If sort orientation is left to right, the index represents row index.
The sort orientation: top to bottom or left to right.
Indicates whether the sorting is case sensitive.

<appSettings>

</appSettings>

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.GridWeb.ACWLanguageFileUrl

By default, a built-in english file is used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.GridWeb.EditMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the control's edit mode.
member.remarks: When sets to true, the control's cells are editable, and the "save" and the "undo" icon are displayed. When sets to false, the control's cells are readonly, and the "save" and the "undo" icon are not displayed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.GridWeb.SessionMode
member.summary:
Gets or sets the session mode of the grid. There are 3 type of session mode:
1. Session(default): Use system session to store sheet data.
Generally the asp.net uses InProc session state. The grid also supports "StateServer" out process session state and SQLServer session state.
2. ViewState: Use page's viewstate to store sheet data.
3. Custom: Use LoadCustomData and SheetDataUpdated events to store/recover sheet data.
member.remarks: When using SessionMode.ViewState, the grid will store sheets data in the page's view state. This will decrease the server's memory usage, but the page's size will be larger and it will impact the overall performance.

example.code:
[C#] GridWeb1.SessionMode = SessionMode.ViewState;
[Visual Basic] GridWeb1.SessionMode = SessionMode.ViewState

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.GridWeb.CustomStyleFileName

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:

[Visual Basic]

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: T:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.PivotCache
member.summary: Represents the memory cache for a PivotTable report. The PivotCache object is a member of the collection.
member.remarks: Uses the PivotCache method to return a PivotCache object for a PivotTable report (each report has only one cache). The source data of PivotCache come from WebWorksheet, DataTable, and so on.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.PivotCache.CreatePivotTable
member.summary: Creates PivotTable report to a new Sheet.
member.remarks: Calling this method will create a PivotTable object and a new worksheet. Then adds the PivotTable object to the last location of GridWeb.Worksheets.PivotTables. If You call the PivotTable.DataBind() method, the PivotTable report will be painted to the created worksheet.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.PivotCache.CreatePivotTable(System.String)

member.remarks: Calling this method will create a PivotTable object and a new worksheet. Then adds the PivotTable object to the last location of GridWeb.Worksheets.PivotTables. If You call the PivotTable.DataBind() method, the PivotTable report will be painted to the created worksheet.

member.summary: Creates PivotTable report to the targetSheet.
member.param: The sheet that the pivotTable report will paint to
The start cell that the pivotTable report will paint to
member.remarks: Calling this method will create a PivotTable object Then adds the PivotTable object to the last location of GridWeb.Worksheets.PivotTables. If You call the PivotTable.DataBind() method, the PivotTable report will be painted to the targetSheet starting at the targetCell.
